data.title: Michigan State University Board of Trustees names new Board Chair, Vice Chair
data.meta_description: Dr. Rema Vassar was elected to the Michigan State University Board of Trustees for an eight-year term Wednesday.
data.text:
Leadership is changing within the Michigan State University Board of Trustees.

Trustee Dr. Rema Vassar was elected Board Chair of the Michigan State University Board of Trustees for a two-year term during their first meeting of the year Wednesday.

Michigan State University:

"I wore my Shirley Chisholm earrings today to remind me of those who came before me in brave leadership," Vassar said. "Shirley said she is a catalyst for change. I’m channeling her as we make progressive change across the global Spartan community."

The first Black woman to serve as chair of the board, Vassar is anticipated to replace Dianne Byrum, who is stepping down from a leadership position but will remain a member of the board, officials said.

As Board Chair, Vassar will be responsible for representing the board in official statements, overseeing committee assignments, establishing meeting agendas, and assisting with the facilitation of meetings, according to Michigan State University.

Trustee Dan Kelly was elected to return to his role as Vice Chair for his third term.

“I share the optimism expressed by my colleagues today,” Kelly said. “I look forward to working with Trustee Vassar as our new chair, the new board members who have joined us and with Interim President Woodruff.”

A doctorate graduate of UCLA, Vassar currently serves as Professor in the department of Administrative and Organizational Studies at Wayne State University's College of Education, according to her Michigan State University biography.

She has authored many scholarly journal articles, and her research interests include the following:

Parent-school partnerships

Race, gender, and class implications in schools

Implications of policy and practice on student achievement and outcomes

Equity, justice, access, and inclusion for minoritized communities

Vassar additionally has extensive experience in K-12 public education, and has served for over 20 years as a teacher, counselor, and principal, according to her university biography.

Michigan football:

She was appointed by Gov. Gretchen Whitmer to the MiSTEM Advisory Council for a three-year term in 2023, and maintains a commitment to community service through partnerships with various Michigan school districts to develop students and educators' leadership skills, her biography said.

Vassar's term runs through January 2025.

Previously, Kelly served for six years on the Oakland Community College Board of Trustees as both a trustee and the Board Chair, according to his MSU biography.

He also served two four-year terms on the Independence Township Board of Trustees, and is currently a practicing attorney specializing in general municipal, real estate, corporate and labor law.

As Vice Chair, Kelly is responsible for assuming the duties of board chair during the chair's absence and if the board chair's position becomes vacated until a new board chair is elected, according to the university.

The board also elected other new officers during their meeting Wednesday.

They include: Dennis Denno, Sandy Pierce, Stefan Fletcher, and Kelly Tebay, the university said in a release.

The next regularly scheduled board meeting for the MSU Board of Trustees is scheduled for Friday, Feb. 10.
